verses.roman:
peṭera bhitara hasta-pada--kūrmera ākāra
mukhe phena, pulakāṅga, netre aśru-dhāra

synonyms: peṭera—the abdomen; bhitara—within; hasta-pada—the arms and legs; kūrmera ākāra—just like a tortoise; mukhe—in the mouth; phena—foam; pulaka-aṅga—eruptions on the body; netre—in the eyes; aśru-dhāra—a flow of tears.
translation: His arms and legs had entered the trunk of His body, exactly like those of a tortoise. His mouth was foaming, there were eruptions on His body, and tears flowed from His eyes.
